sentence.Network_en: Buying a house can be a very tiresome business.
sentence.Network_cn: 买房子会是件很麻烦的事。

sentence.Network_en: He can be a very tiresome child at times.
sentence.Network_cn: 他有时候会是一个非常讨厌的孩子.

sentence.Network_en: His doubts and hesitations were tiresome.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的疑惑和犹豫令人厌烦.

list.abs: He can be a very tiresome child at times ., 他有时候会是一个非常讨厌的孩子.
He is a tiresome child ., 他是一个烦人的小孩.
what a tiresome fellow you are ., 你真是个烦人的家伙.
me , how my poor head is vexed and worried by that girl Gupe's so perseveringly asking , again , about her tiresome letters !上帝保佑我，朱浦这个女孩子，一而再，再而三不断地钉住问她那讨厌的信，真叫我可怜的脑袋烦躁不堪！
selling your house can be a tiresome business .卖房子有时候是很麻烦的事。

entry.tran: 讨厌的;烦人的;令人厌倦的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as tiresome, you mean that you find them irritating or boring.

example.ex: It would be too tiresome to wait in the queue.

means.word_mean: 1. so lacking in interest as to cause mental weariness;

sentences.sentence: "the deadening effect of some routine tasks"
"a ho-hum speaker who couldn't capture their attention"
"what an irksome task the writing of long letters is"- Edmund Burke
"the tiresome chirping of a cricket"- Mark Twain

auth_sentence.content: This would be tiresome at the best of times.

auth_sentence.content: The lack of variety in enemies can get tiresome.

auth_sentence.content: It's tiresome to try to prove commonsense things!
